contextId.information: These two words share similar meanings. AT: "a statute of the law" or "a legal statute" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two words mean basically the same thing and emphasize that this animal is to have no imperfections. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The phrase "the whole community" emphasizes that every person who was a part of "the people of Israel" was present, without exception. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: The people of Israel, the whole community

contextId.information: These two phrases have very similar meanings. They emphasize what she has promised to do. AT: "her vow" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
